item.title: Pam add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Pam add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Pam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Pam add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Well, my dear, take heart. Some day, I will kiss you and you will like it. But not now, so I beg you not to be too impatient." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Pam add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I can't think about that right now. If I do, I'll go crazy. I'll think about that tomorrow." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Pam add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A self is not something static, tied up in a pretty parcel and handed to the child, finished and complete. A self is always becoming." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Pam add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Pam add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat, or a prostitute." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Pam add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Pam add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: Pam add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Set wide the window. Let me drink the day." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Pam add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Pam add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "It was one of those humid days when the atmosphere gets confused. Sitting on the porch, you could feel it: the air wishing it was water." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Pam add a quote by George Plimpton
item.description: "I have never been convinced there's anything inherently wrong in having fun. " -- George Plimpton

item.title: Pam add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Pam add a quote by Nikolai V. Gogol
item.description: "The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes." -- Nikolai V. Gogol

item.title: Pam add a quote by Hans Christian Andersen
item.description: "But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more." -- Hans Christian Andersen

item.title: Pam add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Pam add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Pam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pam add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Pam add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "This toast feels raw. Is it safe to eat raw toast?" -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Pam add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Grief, a type of sadness that most often occurs when you have lost someone you love, is a sneaky thing, because it can disappear for a long time, and then pop back up when you least expect it." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Pam add a quote by Laurie Notaro
item.description: "Books are to me as homemade tattoos are to an inmate. Can't get enough of them." -- Laurie Notaro

item.title: Pam add a quote by Laurie Notaro
item.description: "It's okay," my husband said, shuffling toward his study. "I bought an electric-powered chain saw with a plug-in cord so if I run away fast enough, you can only chase me so far." -- Laurie Notaro

item.title: Pam add a quote by Margaret Wise Brown
item.description: "Goodnight stars, goodnight air, goodnight noises everywhere." -- Margaret Wise Brown

item.title: Pam add a quote by Maxine Kumin
item.description: "Cherish your wilderness." -- Maxine Kumin

item.title: Pam add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I read a book one day and my whole life was changed." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Pam add a quote by Johanna Spyri
item.description: "I want to go about like the light-footed goats." -- Johanna Spyri

item.title: Pam add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end." -- Gilda Radner
